timeline.message: Move lex logic in PushIdGenerator, fix tests

timeline.bodyText: Do you know what the 2 is meant to indicate? If not, I suggest we remove it from here and above.

timeline.message: Fix push id generation scheme, add test to detect breakage

timeline.bodyText: Also a 2 as a suffix.

timeline.bodyText: Nit: This is usually called a successor.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: This looks like it could trigger an integer overflow. You could probably just use a long here, unless there are some specifications for valid keys that I am not aware of.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

replies.bodyText:
Using a long should be fine, the limit on keys is 768 bytes:
https://firebase.google.com/docs/database/usage/limits#data_tree
replies.author: IanWyszynski

replies.bodyText:
The only other place we're using tryParseInt is in:

  
    
      firebase-android-sdk/firebase-database/src/main/java/com/google/firebase/database/snapshot/ChildrenNode.java
    
    
         Line 134
      in
      e65f487
    
    
    
    

        
          
           Integer keyAsInt = Utilities.tryParseInt(key); 
        
    
  


Where it seems to be used to decide the number of results in an array. I think we should be able to change the method to tryParseLong without risk.
replies.author: IanWyszynski

replies.bodyText:
Upon further consideration, I think we should handle the overflow here. In our public docs, we assume at most 32-bit integer keys for ordering semantics:
https://firebase.google.com/docs/database/web/lists-of-data
I wonder if it's reasonable to return MIN_PUSH_CHAR here since that's the next string in our documented key ordering.
replies.author: IanWyszynski

timeline.bodyText:
Nit: Flip assignments for clarity.
You could also refer to PUSH_CHARS and get the values from there (which will be slower and more code, so I am not sure it is actually worth it).
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

replies.bodyText: I sort of prefer having separate sentinel values for this since they trigger edge-cases in the successor/predecessor code.
replies.author: IanWyszynski

timeline.bodyText: This is unused.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: These changes don't seem to be needed.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.message: Return the proper value from successor

timeline.bodyText:
Totally optional:
s/WhenLimitIsHitFromFront/WhenDataEntersLimit
Here and below if you do update.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to convert num to long. In Java, long+int=long (and the int is treated as a long)
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Optional nit: Remove empty line above.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.bodyText: Let's talk about this offline. My gut feeling is that this should match all results, since they order past null.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

replies.bodyText:
I added an explanation here: https://github.com/firebase/firebase-ios-sdk/pull/7209/files#r556060181.
I know this reads funny, but I think it is the intended behavior because we are indexing on priority.
replies.author: IanWyszynski

timeline.bodyText: The expected state should come before the actual state. I think you need to flip the arguments everywhere.
timeline.author: schmidt-sebastian

timeline.message:
Implement `endBefore` for RTDB queries (#2302)

* Implement `endBefore` for RTDB queries

* cleanup

* Fix bug in prevBefore

* Handle endBefore(..., Integer.MIN_VALUE)

* respect key ordering

* Add more tests, check key order boundary conditions

* Generate api text file

* Unit tests for predecessor

* cleanup
